content.description:
This is a good stop to hone your slab skills with three quality slab problems located here...Xenon Slab climbs the left hand blank slab, Stuck in the Middle climbs the middle and DeWeese Slab climbs the right. 

  For Xenon, step up and left and continue on crystals to the top.
content.location: Beam Me Up Scotty area...past Yellow Arete, across the lake, up the old road, located on the left side.

content.description: Establish onto a sloping rounded rail and climb slab to the top.
content.location: Left hand side of slab left of Beam Me up Scotty

content.description: Stuck in the Middle climbs the middle line up the blank slab...stay in the middle.
content.location: Beam Me Up Scotty area...past Yellow Arete, across the lake, up the old road on the left hand side.

content.description: Short crack with SDS.  Very hard to get established in this overhanging jam fest.  Once you get in you may find it even harder to pull over the overhang to exit.
content.location: This climb is located in the Beam me Up Scotty area.  It is behind McGilla Gorilla and more directly behind the slab with Tourist Route, etc...

content.description: Sit start down under boulder with good holds. Make some powerful compression moves and mantle out.
content.location: If you're looking at Beam Me Up Scotty or Tourist Route, this boulder is right behind you.

content.description: Fun little route start on thin crimps and reach high above little roof to arete. Underside of cap is off. Follow arete to the top.
content.location: Beam me up scotty area. About 15 feet right of beam me up has a little roof triangle 8 feet up.

content.description: Blank slab with sparse friction holds lead to a slopey top out.  Overcoming getting established and making the first move is the crux.
content.location: This is the blank slab that is to the immediate right of Fanny Seat.  It is located behind Mcgilla Gorilla in the Beam Me Up Scotty area.

content.description: Start matched on the crimpy rail, heel hook right and throw to slopey rail.
content.location: in the Beam Me Up Scotty area, the stand start of McGilla Gorilla Sit

content.description: Rad sit start to crimpy, with some classic boatrock friction at the top, ohh its good, real good!!!
content.protection: Pad, but its not too tall maybe 11ft
content.location: in the beam me up area, behind tourist route, its the obvious sit, with a good right crimp, and a weird left, you start under a block/roof reach around left to crimp/side pull

content.description:
Crimp a seam, turn it into a mantel, establish on the slab and friction to the top. 

  The start is tricky and I was once give the beta  "All ya gotta do is...." then he proceeded to pull the crux with a Marlboro Red in his mouth. Humbling and hilarious
content.protection: pad and a spotter to keep you off a rock
content.location: Right hand side of slab left of Beam me up scotty.

content.description: High crimps and bad feet led to improving crimps and better feet as you step right and join Tourist Route.
content.location: Just to the left of Tourist Route.

content.description: Crux is getting onto the slab for most.  Very short.  Only two to three moves.
content.location: Near Beam me Up on the opposite side of the formation.  Keep walking right around the corner from Awkward Crack.

content.description: Nice rail and a few crimps, that’s it!
content.location: 3 feet right of Craig’s Slab, 6 feet right of Tourist Route

content.description: Sit down start between opposing sidepulls. Move up and mantel through the blank, slopey top-out section.
content.location: Just Left of McGilla Gorilla

content.description: Weirdly formed boulder with multiple jugs/pockets and even a seat.  Start low and go up and left.
content.location: If you go to Beam me up Scotty and squeeze through the rocks to get Behind McGilla Gorilla, you will find this area.  Left of Motor Slab.

content.description: One of three slab lines on this boulder.  DeWeese is the blank slab on the right.
content.location: Beam Me Up Scotty Area...past Yellow Arete and across the lake.  Up the old road on the left.

content.description: Climb smears and crimps up slab.
content.location: Middle slab problem on boulder left of Beam Me up Scotty.

content.description: Work obvious flake on backside of motor slab. Mantel the flake and finish with a mantel topout.
content.location: Behind motor slab next to mcgilla gorilla.

content.description: Very fun easy moves lead you left on the ramp to good holds at the top.
content.location: This route is directly left of Beam me up Scotty.  It is a left leaning ramp with a small finger crack.

content.description: Short slab with a few slopey bulges.
content.location: Beam Me Up area around the corner and to the right of Awkward Crack. Next to a tree.

content.description: Good hand crack that varies in size.  Jam your way up over the bulge to the left, then over the boulder at the top.  Some folks stay in the crack and top out using a face hold at the far right.  Saw it listed as V3+, in '07 comp.
content.location: This route is located near the lake that is in the back part of Boat Rock.  To get there, take the main trail past Spiderman, then past Yellow Arete, then go down and to the left on the trail.  Cross the small bridge over the creek/lake and go back up and to the left.  This is the prominent left leaning hand crack.

content.description: Crux is getting into the crack.  One more move and your done.
content.location: Short awkward left leaning crack to the right of Beam me Up Scotty.

content.description: Hit "Improve This Page" to submit a description!
